member.name: M:TrustedDoge.DecimalExtensions.MuchExtensions.GetDecimalDigits(System.Decimal,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Tells you how many decimal digits a number has.
member.param: The number of which you want to know the amount of decimal digits.
If , trailing zeros are ignored, so 0.01000 can result in 2 if set to , or 5 if it is set to ./>

member.name: M:TrustedDoge.DecimalExtensions.MuchExtensions.RoundUp(System.Decimal,System.Int32)
member.summary: Rounds up a number to next bigger number with the chosen decimal precision.
member.param: The decimal precision for the result.

member.name: M:TrustedDoge.DecimalExtensions.MuchExtensions.RoundDown(System.Decimal,System.Int32)
member.summary: Rounds down a number to next smaller number with the chosen decimal precision.
member.param: The decimal precision for the result.
